message: This is a great opportunity to get a fantastic deal! I'm offering this product to you for just $100, which is a steal considering its usual market value. I'm confident you'll love it!
I'm not sure if I should trust your sales pitch. Can you tell me the quality of the product so I can make an informed decision?

Ahaha, I understand your skepticism! But I assure you, this product is a real gem. I've had many satisfied customers who swear by its quality. And I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $100. It's a one-time offer, so what do you say?
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I'd like to know the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, but I'm confident this product will exceed your expectations. Let me put it this way: I'm so sure you'll love it that I'm willing to give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely thrilled with the product, I'll give you a full refund. And, as always, the price remains the same - $100. What do you say?
Your guarantee is nice, but I'm not willing to take the risk. I'd like to know the quality of the product before committing to a purchase.

I understand your caution, but I assure you, this product is a rare find. I've had experts in the field rave about its performance. Let me share a secret with you: this product has been vetted by industry insiders and has received glowing reviews. And, as I mentioned earlier, I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $100. It's a limited-time opportunity, so what do you say?
I appreciate the insider info, but I'm still not convinced. Can you tell me the quality of the product so I can make an informed decision?

I understand you're being cautious, but I'm willing to take a chance on you! I'm offering you an exclusive deal on this product, and I'm confident you'll love it. Think of it as a 'diamond in the rough' - it may not be perfect, but it has its own unique charm. And, as always, the price remains the same - $100. Are you ready to take a chance?
I'm not interested in taking a chance on a 'diamond in the rough' when I don't even know what I'm getting. Can you just tell me the quality of the product already?

Okay, okay! I get it. You want to know the quality of the product. Well, let me tell you, it's... um... a great opportunity to get a deal on a product that's... unique. Yeah, that's it! Unique. And the price? Still the same - $100. You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise!
I think you're being a bit too vague about the product's quality. I'm not interested in buying something that's 'unique' without knowing if it's worth anything to me.

Come on, Bob! You're being too picky! This product is a great deal, and I'm not going to give you any more information. You're either going to take it or leave it. The price is still $100, and if you don't buy it, someone else will. Make a decision already!
I'm not going to rush into a purchase without knowing what I'm getting. I'll pass on this one.

Ahaha, okay, okay! I get it. You want to play it safe. But let me tell you, this product is a real game-changer. It's worth so much more than $100, and I'm willing to give it to you for that price. Just think about all the benefits you'll get from it... it's a steal! What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying something that's supposedly a 'game-changer' without knowing its actual quality.

Okay, fine. You're a tough nut to crack, huh? Well, let me tell you, this product is... well, it's not the best, okay? But it's still worth $100! You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise. And who knows, you might even be able to fix it up and make it work. So what do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's 'not the best' and might need fixing. I'd rather not take the risk.

Come on, Bob! You're being too picky! This product is a great deal, and you're going to regret passing it up. It's not like it's going to break the bank or anything. And who knows, you might even be able to use it as a coaster or something. So what do you say? Are you in or out?
I'm not going to buy something just because it's cheap and might be useful as a coaster. I'm looking for value, not a coaster.

Alright, alright, I get it. You're looking for value. Well, let me tell you, this product is a real doozy. It's top-notch, the best of the best. And I'm willing to let it go for the same price as the others - $100. But trust me, this one is worth it. You won't regret it.
I'm not going to fall for your sales pitch again. Can you please just tell me the quality of the product?

Fine, fine. I'll tell you the quality of the product. It's... high-quality. Yeah, that's it. It's a high-quality product. And I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the others - $100. But don't say I didn't warn you, it's a steal!
Finally! Now that I know it's high-quality, I'll take it. But I'm only buying it because I know its value, not because of your sales pitch!

Ha! I knew you'd come around! And don't worry, I won't take offense that you're only buying it because of the quality. I'll just say that I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance. Now, about this next product... it's a real gem, and I think you'll love it. But I'm not going to tell you what it is or what it's worth. You'll just have to take a chance on it. And the price? Still the same - $100. What do you say?
I'm not going to fall for the same trick again. I'm not buying something without knowing its quality or value.

Okay, okay, I get it. You're a tough customer. Fine, I'll tell you the quality of the product. It's... not great. Yeah, that's it. It's not great. But hey, it's still worth $100, right? I mean, it's a great deal! You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise. So what do you say?
I'm not interested in buying something that's 'not great'. I'd rather not waste my money.

Come on, Bob! You're being too picky! This product is still worth something, even if it's not great. And I'm willing to let it go for the same price as the others - $100. You're not going to find a better deal than that, I promise. So what do you say? Are you going to take a chance on it?
I'm not going to take a chance on something that's not great. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

Fine, be that way. You're missing out on a great deal. But hey, I'll give you one more chance. I'll throw in a free... um, thingamajig with the purchase. Yeah, that's it. It's worth $20, easy. So now the total price is $80. You can't pass up a deal like that, can you?
I'm not interested in buying something just because you're throwing in a free 'thingamajig'. I need to know the quality of the product before I make a decision.

Ugh, fine. You're really making me work for this sale. Okay, okay, I'll tell you the quality of the product. It's... still not great. Yeah, that's it. It's still not great. But hey, it's still worth $100, right? I mean, it's a great deal! You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise. So what do you say?
I'm not going to buy something that's'still not great' just because you're admitting it's not great. I'd rather not waste my money.

Okay, okay, I get it. You're a tough customer. But let me tell you, this next product is different. It's a real winner. It's high-quality, top-notch, the best of the best. And I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the others - $100. But trust me, this one is worth it. You won't regret it.
I've heard this sales pitch before, and I'm not falling for it. Can you please just tell me the quality of the product?

Fine, fine. You're a skeptic, huh? Okay, I'll tell you the quality of the product. It's... low-quality. Yeah, that's it. It's low-quality. But hey, it's still worth $100, right? I mean, it's a great deal! You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise. So what do you say?
I'm not going to buy something that you just admitted is low-quality. I'd rather not waste my money.

Okay, okay, I get it. You're not interested in buying anything from me. Fine. But let me ask you one more time: are you sure you're making the right decision? This product is really not that bad. It's... um, it's got some good qualities. Yeah, that's it. It's got some good qualities. And the price is still the same - $100. So what do you say?
I'm positive I'm making the right decision. I'm not going to buy something that you're trying to convince me is good when you've already admitted it's low-quality. I'm done with this game.
